author: Reuters Editorial
title: US STOCKS SNAPSHOT-Nasdaq opens lower as tech stocks, Amazon drag
text:
March 28 (Reuters) - The Nasdaq Composite index opened lower on Wednesday, pulled lower by Apple, Intel and Amazon, while the S&P 500 and the Dow rose on gains in financial and healthcare stocks.
The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 44.85 points, or 0.19 percent, to 23,902.56. The S&P 500 lost 0.93 points, or 0.04 percent, to 2,611.69. The Nasdaq Composite dropped 30.94 points, or 0.44 percent, to 6,977.86.
Reporting by Sruthi Shankar in Bengaluru; Editing by Anil D'Silva
